value: <l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">12</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Latimer had read the 
            <choice>
              <sic>Lord</sic>
              <corr>Lord's</corr>
            </choice> Prayer in English. The Bible</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">was printed in English. And, using the prose of the bible</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">when they write prose, the 
            <choice>
              <sic>Elixabethans</sic>
              <corr>Elizabethans</corr>
            </choice> are 
            <choice>
              <sic>unknwon</sic>
              <corr>unknown</corr>
            </choice> to us.</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">When in some extremity of anguish or fear they take up the</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">pen they use the 
            <choice>
              <sic>rhyms</sic>
              <corr>rhythms</corr>
            </choice> of the Bible. 
            <choice>
              <sic>Itis</sic>
              <corr>It is</corr>
            </choice> a garment only</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">to be worn when the mind is in the right 
            <choice>
              <sic>attidtue</sic>
              <corr>attitude</corr>
            </choice>. They can</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">say nothing simple, subtle, or 
            <choice>
              <sic>breif</sic>
              <corr>brief</corr>
            </choice>. At <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-gorh" key="Gorhambury">
              <choice>
                <sic>Gorham nury</sic>
                <corr>Gorhambury</corr>
              </choice></rs> Lady</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-abac" key="Bacon, Anne">Ann Bacon</rs> sat writing to <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-fbac" key="Bacon, Francis">her son</rs>. But her letters are like</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">
            <choice>
              <sic>seroms</sic>
              <corr>sermons</corr>
            </choice>, or 
            <choice>
              <sic>satte doucments</sic>
              <corr>state documents</corr>
            </choice>, intricate, involved,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">circumtutious. She is a counsellor admonishing a subordinate;</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">She 
            <choice>
              <sic>e hosrts</sic>
              <corr>exhorts</corr>
            </choice> <quote source="#" rend="inline">God keep us sound in the faith</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">and send us health and a care to please God before all."</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">She admonishes <quote source="#" rend="inline">Be not speedy of speech, nor talk</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">
            <choice>
              <sic>suuddenly</sic>
              <corr>suddenly</corr>
            </choice>, 
            <choice>
                <sic>discrteion</sic>
                <corr>discretion</corr>
            </choice>
            <choice>
              <sic>requieth</sic>
              <corr>requireth</corr>
            </choice> and that</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">soberly then..."</quote> If she has to descend to an actual object</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">a basket of 
            <choice>
              <sic>starwberries</sic>
              <corr>strawberries</corr>
            </choice> it is with c dark 
            <choice>
              <sic>insintuat ons</sic>
              <corr>insinuations</corr>
            </choice>.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">Greek and 
            <choice>
              <sic>atin</sic>
              <corr>Latin</corr>
            </choice> come as easily to her pen as</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">English. There is no 
            <choice>
              <sic>gaity</sic>
              <corr>gaiety</corr>
            </choice>, no freedom no 
            <choice>
              <sic>familairty</sic>
              <corr>familiarity</corr>
            </choice></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">in this world. Fear of God, 
            <choice>
              <sic>suspciion</sic>
              <corr>suspicion</corr>
            </choice> of man surround</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the writer as with the 
            <choice>
              <sic>wlls</sic>
              <corr>walls</corr>
            </choice> of a dungeon. The wall may</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">conceal a Lady Ann 
            <choice>
              <sic>whois</sic>
              <corr>who is</corr>
            </choice>merry and gay; it may <del hand="ms">conceal</del></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">must 
            <choice>
              <sic>cobneceal</sic>
              <corr>conceal</corr>
            </choice> passion, laughter and sorrow;</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">but no one can tell who it is that lives on the other side</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of the wall of formal 
            <choice>
              <sic>langauge</sic>
              <corr>language</corr>
            </choice>.</l>
